Title: Antimicrobial peptides and preterm birth
Source: Host Def. Peptides and Their Potential as Therapeutic Agents
Abstract: © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2016.Preterm birth (delivery before 37 completed weeks of pregnancy) is a major problem worldwide, leading to high mortality and significant long-term morbidity. A complex interaction between ascending lower genital tract infection and the maternal immune system is a likely underlying component of pathogenesis. In this chapter we consider the ways in which expression of antimicrobial peptides in the maternal genital tract may modulate the risk of ascending genital tract infection and thus the risk of preterm birth.
